hints.content:
Multiplication and division are related:

$\begin{align}
\greenD{\text{number of groups}} \times \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \times \greenD{\text{number of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \greenD{\text{number of groups}} =\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} =\greenD{\text{number of groups}}
\end{align}$

In this fact family, the $\purpleC{\text{total}}$ is $\purpleC{63}$.

The $\greenD{\text{number of the groups}}$ is $\greenD{7}$.

![Tape diagram showing 63 is equal to 7 equal groups of question mark](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a28441501a8d5d89969258a6c2c7b47ff353fc39)

The $\maroonD{\text{size of the groups}}$ is ${\maroonD{?}}$.
The equation $\greenD{7} \times {\maroonD{?}} = \purpleC{63}$ can help us find the unknown number.

question.content:
**Create an equation to help us find the unknown number in $63 \div 7 = {?}$ .**

$7\times{}$ [[☃ dropdown 4]] $=$ [[☃ dropdown 5]]
